column5: Hi Sidge61, Have a great time and be safe. Thank you,Larry Mac
IM always afraid I will oversleep so I set my alarm clock on the nightstand and then the alarm on my Iphone and put it next to me in bed..always end up getting up 15-20 mins before they go off..
To all of you that are heading north, have a sfae and enjoyable trip!!!!!! Just leave some fish in the lake and don't drink all the rye.

To all leaving for the promise land...have a safe, enjoyable trip.Unfortunately, I could not go this year, but we are booked for next june. I too have the fever, but afraid it's setting in too soon. The countdown is well over 300 days. I hope to live through all of your posts as you return.Enjoy your trips!pikeman

It's 11:15pm and I need to be up by 4:30 to head to Ear Falls are. Flying out on Friday to Jeannette Lake with Kabeelo. The thought of the first hookset has me going. I don't care if the forecast is mostly sunny, hot and with little to no wind. We'll make it work somehow. Best of luck to everyone else heading up north soon. Ten Horse
Understand completely. I have the same issue before we leave. Excited, going thru my lists, wondering if I forgot something. My head just won't slow down. Good luck and have a safe trip.

Yes another good person is stricken with the dreaded walleye fever!! I've seen these symptoms before, it is not a terminal condidtion thanks to modern treatments. As a health care professional, I would gladly offer my services to you for this trip. My fees are most reasonable. I would however need to be with you the boat and cabins to monitor your case!!
We all go through it, the only remedy I have found is to leave a day early!

Our drive is from Appleton, WI to a base lodge 35 miles north of Ear Falls. We're about 10 miles from Chippewa Falls right now. I got three hours of sleep last night and I'm wide awake. Fortunately, I'm not driving.
Well good luck and enjoy your trip. I'm leaving in 15 days up to Ignace. WOO!
I am leaving from Chippewa Falls tomorrow morning at 6 for Lac Seul. I am sure sleep will not be plentiful tonight. Good Luck.

Hey Ten Horse, Even after a long drive and a beverage or two,tonight's sleep will be filled with dreams of the open water and the first rush with the first tap tap on the end of your line!! In a few days when your head its the pillow you will feel the gentle rocking after getting your "sea legs" back! Catch some for us back home! Have a great trip!!
Leave tomorrow morning at 3AM from St. Point, headed to Sioux lookout. Packing and re-packing and always wondering what I'm forgetting and what I still need. Wetting a line Saturday!!!!
